page.title: 17HOOK NORTON-BUILDINGS
page.content: Percy Hacklin took us on a walk around the village to show us where all the different tradesmen used to be. Over the top of Central Stores there are lots of little windows where a weaver worked. Where the bus stop is was a blacksmith. 4, Bell Hill used to be a bakers. You can still see the bulge that was the drying oven. The baker was called Father Christmas and he used to go round in a horse and cart selling his bread and cakes. Down by the bakery is an old spring where people came down and got their water using a yoke. Rope Way was so called because they used to make rope there from one end of the road to the other by walking backwards and plaiting it all the way. Where Mr. Stubbibgton's shop is used to be a boot and shoe mender. The thatcher's house used to be a carriers that went to Banbury twice a day.
